intro: Fourcroya, commonly known as the evergreen tree or evergreen shrub, is a member of the Lauraceae family. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and Georgia. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 15 feet. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a glossy appearance. Fourcroya produces small, fragrant flowers that are followed by dark blue, egg-shaped berries.
